item.title: InMobi Revenue Reporting
item.description: We’ve recently updated revenue reporting for InMobi to reflect InMobi’s latest API.  If you previously set up MoPub revenue reporting for InMobi, you need to contact InMobi and update your InMobi information on MoPub to ensure your reports continue to work. Important Notes:...

item.title: Create and Manage a Segment (Ad Networks)
item.description: Segments Overview MoPub’s network management interface allows you to group your inventory into “segments”. A “segment” is a slice of your inventory with specific apps or ad units that can be targeted to specific countries and networks. It is a combination of three variables...

item.title: Chartboost Revenue Reporting
item.description: In order to set up revenue reporting for Chartboost, you need to first set up Chartboost as a network. Directions to set up Chartboost. In order to set up Chartboost for revenue reporting, you will need to enter in your Chartboost User ID and Chartboost User Signature into the MoPub UI....

item.title: Chartboost Network Setup
item.description: In order to set up Chartboost, you will need the most recent MoPub SDKs for iOS and Android. iOS: https://github.com/mopub/mopub-ios-sdk/ Android: https://github.com/mopub/mopub-android-sdk/ 1. You will first need to integrate the Chartboost SDK and Chartboost supporting...

item.title: Ad Networks FAQ
item.description: What networks does MoPub support? MoPub supports dozens of the most popular ad networks via server-to-server connections. For a list of standard supported networks, visit here. In addition to these networks, you can set up any network on MoPub via a "Custom Event". These...

item.title: What is an Order & Line Item?
item.description: In order to monetize your app with MoPub, you will need to set up orders and line items. In this section you will find more information on orders and line items. An Order is a a group of related Line Items, which are also known as campaigns. Line items are campaigns that have different...

item.title: MoPub Technical Integration
item.description: Here you can find more information on how to work with various networks by creating Custom Event classes. You will also find technical integration and support guides. If you have a specific issue that is not addressed here, please feel free to post a topic in our Discussion Forum or contact...

item.title: Editing a Line Item
item.description: This page allows you to take a detailed look at a specific Line Item.    The overall Line Item can be edited by clicking ‘Edit Line Item’.   Line Items can be paused, resumed, or archived.   On this page, you can add creative by clicking on the “...

item.title: Twitter | MoPub Server-to-Server API Technical Specifications 1.0
item.description: Overview The MoPub Server-to-Server API makes it easier for ad networks and demand partners to connect with the MoPub platform outside of SDK libraries. To integrate with MoPub through the Server-to-Server API, follow the integration approval process and technical specifications...

item.title: MoPub Overview
item.description: What is MoPub? MoPub is a mobile ad serving platform. We help you monetize your apps more effectively. We offer a free, self-serve product that lets you get started with ad serving quickly while offering sophisticated features that you will need as you grow. With streamlined campaign management,...

item.title: Understanding UTC Time (Time Zones)
item.description: How to read charts in UTC In a chart, each bar in your MoPub interface represents 1 day in UTC time. For example, if you are in Pacific time and looking at yesterday’s data, that represents data starting from 5:00 PM PDT 2 days before until 4:59 PM PDT yesterday. Stated otherwise, it...

item.title: JavaScript Interfaces for Twitter for Websites
item.description: By using Twitter JavaScript, you agree to the Developer Rules of the Road. If you're integrating your site with Twitter using Twitter for Websites and Web Intents, you can enhance your application using JavaScript. By default, widgets-js will find mark-up in a page and convert basic, functional...
